Name: Earrings of Tutankhamun
Description: These simple earrings, made of unglazed faience, were found in the tomb of Tutankhamun. They are the type of earrings that were worn by the African enemies depicted on the walls of Egyptian temples.Earrings were probably introduced into Egypt by the Hyksos, the Asiatic invaders who settled in Egypt during the Second Intermediate Period. They were worn by both sexes although it appears that males wore them only until adolescence; they are never seen in representations of adult men.
